title: Applikationskonsult inom Dynamics 365 CRM
description:
Vårt härliga CRM-team söker fler härliga kollegor!

Är du intresserad av att arbeta på Sveriges Bästa Arbetsplatser 2023? Som blivit utsedda till Karriärföretag flera år i rad och som av Gartner rankas till ett topp fem bolag inom Digital Transformation? Då är IT-konsult och managementbolaget Sopra Steria en plats för dig. Som medarbetare på Sopra Steria blir du en del av kulturen ”Tillsammans når vi längre” och får arbeta tillsammans med ett genuint, nyfiket och drivet team. Vi tror på Power of Sharing och arbetar ständigt med att dela med oss av våra kunskaper mellan varandra och till samhället i stort. Vi står nu inför en spännande tillväxtresa som genomsyrar hela verksamheten där det finns stora möjligheter att växa tillsammans med bolaget. I Sverige är vi idag ca 550 kollegor och i den globala koncernen är vi hela 50 000 medarbetare fördelat över 30 länder och kan vara med att påverka digitaliseringens framfart på riktigt!

Om rollen:

Rollen som applikationskonsult är bred och anpassas mycket efter den erfarenhet du själv bidrar med. Här jobbar du nära verksamheten och dina arbetsuppgifter kan till exempel inkludera anpassningar av systemet, systemtester, framtagande av lösning, konfiguration, att skriva javascript eller kanske att skapa lösningar för migrering. Du arbetar ofta i en helhetsleverans tillsammans med andra kollegor från Sopra Steria.

Om dig:

Du är eller har ambitioner att bli en specialist inom Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM och brinner för att skapa värde mot kund och verksamhet. Du har en förmåga att förstå företagsbehov och gillar att arbeta verksamhetsnära. Vi ser också att du lyhörd, kan ta eget ansvar och har stort engagemang i allt du tar dig för. Innanför Sopra Sterias väggar andas gemenskap och prestigelöshet vilket vi ser är något du också värdesätter.

Kompetenser

• Minst 2 års erfarenhet inom Dynamics 365 CRM 
• God kommunikativ förmåga på svenska och engelska i tal och skrift 
• Meriterande om du har erfarenhet inom konsultyrket och/eller har arbetat med tjänster inom Power Platform 

Varför välja oss?

Hos oss kommer du tillhöra ett härligt CRM-team där vi tillsammans hjälps åt framåt och där ”the power of sharing” är en viktig del. Här får du möjligheten att få lära och ständigt utvecklas tillsammans med inkluderande, kompetenta och erfarna kollegor. Förutom härliga kollegor får du givetvis också möjlighet att arbeta för branschens mest spännande kunder och arbeta med ett brett spektrum av projekt som bidrar till samhällsnytta.

På Sopra Steria värdesätter vi möjligheten att jobba flexibelt, vi vet att alla jobbar för att leveransen till kunden ska bli så bra som möjligt, oberoende om arbetet sker hos kund, på kontoret eller hemifrån.

För oss är det en självklarhet att dela kunskap mellan oss och vi löser utmaningar tillsammans. Den kulturen har också bidragit till att vi är utsedda till Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser 2023 av Great Place to Work.

Ansökan

Ansök enkelt genom att antingen ladda upp ditt CV eller länka direkt till ditt LinkedIn-konto via annonsen på vår hemsida! Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar inkomna via mail.

Ansökningar hanteras från mitten av augusti. Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller oss som bolag är du välkommen att kontakta Marie Nordlund, marie.nordlund@soprasteria.com

title: Software Developer with experience
description:
DEK is expanding and therefore looking for an experienced Software developer with knowledge of programming in Python. As an Engineer at DEK, you will be working in-house as a part of our inspiring teams. Your responsibilities will include development, testing, deploying, maintaining and improving the software to meet requirements. The coding will be done in Python and C/C++, for this role you will work in a small team with other engineers within the same project.

Key qualifications for the position:

- BS or MS in computer science, software engineering or similar, alternatively equal knowledge acquired through working experience

- At least 3 years of working experience

- Experience working with Linux environment (Openshift)

- Knowledge of Microservices, Kubernetes, Dockers

- Knowledge and an interest in AI/ML

- Experience in Cloud computing

- Awareness of critical concepts in DevOps and Agile principles

- Fluent in English, spoken and written

- Swedish language is beneficial to have

To be successful in this position we believe it is important that you have a positive mindset with a problem-solving attitude. You are an ambitious developer with a strong inner drive. You enjoy collaboration and discussing ideas with your colleagues and taking on challenges together. Since we are a flat organization working according to Agile methods, we expect you to be self-motivated with the ability to organize your daily work.

DEK Technologies is a technical consultant company with a flat organization aiming to develop proactive and creative solutions. We can offer you an inspiring Agile environment with great possibilities where your personal development and growth are just as important as our business.

Unfortunately, we won't be able to relocate for this position.

Together we develop tomorrow’s technology!

title: DevOps ingenjör - Automatisering och konfigurationshantering
company: NXT Interim Stockholm AB /Hos kund -  Stockholm
description: Din kommande rollSom DevOps ingenjör kommer du att arbeta med vår kunds team för att utveckla och implementera verktyg för automatisering och konfigurationshantering. Du kommer också ha ansvar för övervakning och driftsättning. Du kommer tillhöra ett mindre team med kollegor som besitter kunskap inom olika områden.Eftersom vår kund hanterar exportkontrollerad information krävs svenskt medborgarskap samt att man jobbar 100% hos kunden.Bakgrundkontroll och säkerhetsintervju är också en del av processen.Vi erbjuder ett konsultuppdrag på 6-8 månader för att sedan gå över som fast anställd direkt hos vår kund.Exempel på arbetsuppgifter kan vara:  Programutveckling, (front och/eller back end)   Förvaltning med hjälp av Linux   Utveckling med hjälp av Open Source där du sikt även arbetar med att automatisera de operativa bitarna   Konfigurationshantering Den du är idagVi söker dig som har tidigare erfarenhet inom arbete som DevOps ingenjör eller liknade. Du har erfarenhet av ovanstående punkter och du bör ha god kommunikativ förmåga och ett samarbetsorienterat förhållningssätt.För att trivas i rollen tror vi du har kunskap inom något eller några av nedanstående områden  Golang   ZeroMQ   angular, react, eller vue.js   Helm   Jenkins el motsv   Git   Atlassian   Kubernetes  Vad du blir en del avAffärsområdet hos vår kund har globalt ansvar för utveckling, drift och hantering av företagets gemensamma IT-miljöer. Inom området ”Business Applications” arbetar de med styrning, affärsutveckling och förvaltning inom IS/IT-området. ”Business Applications” har många gånger det primära IT-gränssnittet ansvaret in mot våra stora utvecklingsprojekt hos vår kund och är en stor leverantör av RD-förmågan inom IT.På arbetsplatsen finns en prestigelös kultur där man är professionell  engagerad, respekterar, stöttar och lär av varandra, resultat nås tillsammans som team.Vi på NXT Interim Stockholm AB erbjuder en projektanställning hos oss under ca 8 månader för konsultuppdrag hos vår kund. Syftet är sedan att  gå över som fast anställd hos vår kund.Befattningen kräver att du genomgår och godkänns enligt vid tid gällande bestämmelser för säkerhetsskydd. Det krävs också i samband med detta ett svenskt medborgarskap.Visst låter detta som en spännande roll?Sök redan i dag så berättar vi mer. Vi behöver en ansökan, helst på svenska, inkluderat CV som matchar vår kunds önskemål.Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så vänta inte med din ansökan då vi behöver komplettera med mer information och anbudstiden är kort.NXT Interim och NXT Rekrytering är ett nischat och innovativt företag som är verksamma inom konsult och rekryteringsbranschen.Vi är verksamma inom HR, IT, Ekonomi, Sälj och Marknad och har 20 års erfarenhet i branschen. Vi erbjuder våra konsulter bl a sjukförsäkring, remote-arbetsplatser och flera andra förmåner som förgyller deras vardag. Vid projektanställning tillämpar vi kollektivavtal.

title: Vi söker nu en Systemutvecklare - IP-nätverk!
description:
Vi söker en Software Engineer till vårt utvecklingsteam som designar säkra, mjukvarubaserade IPnätverkselement som används i integrerade kommunikationslösningar. Lösningarna spänner över flertalet teknologier som radio, modem, satellittjänster och IP-nätverk, främst för den militära marknaden.

Rollen som Software Engineer omfattar utveckling, integration och verifiering av IP-nätverkselement. Detta inkluderar mjukvaruutveckling, kravanalys och verifiering av mjukvara på funktions- och systemnivå. Personen vi söker för detta uppdrag har en masterutbildning inom mjukvara och datateknik och är van att arbeta självständigt. Det är någon som har gedigen teknisk bakgrund och erfarenhet av att arbeta i R&D-projekt där behov och krav inte alltid är helt tydliga.

Det är önskvärt med erfarenhet av att arbeta inom försvarsindustrin eller telecom. Detta framförallt då vi söker någon som har förståelse för integration av teknik med särskilda krav, och som har erfarenhet av att med kommunikationsteknik och/eller interoperabilitet.

Heltid på plats i kundens lokaler. Goda möjligheter till förlängning. Urval av kandidater sker löpande.

Kompetenskrav

Den person vi söker måste ha erfarenhet inom följande områden:

- Bakgrund inom mjukvaruutveckling och erfarenhet av att arbeta med öppen källkod (Open Source/FOSS).

- Kunskaper inom utveckling av IP-nätverk och förståelse för integration mellan mjukvara och hårdvara.

- Programspråk som Python, Java, C, C++, Linux, Yocto. Kunskaper i P4 är ett stort plus.

- Svensk medborgare, ej dubbelt medborgarskap och säkerhetskontroll är ett absolut krav!

För att lyckas i detta uppdrag ser vi att nedanstående personliga egenskaper är nödvändiga:

- Lagspelare som är prestigelös, bra på att kommunicera och kan vara både lyhörd för andra men samtidigt ta egna initiativ.

- God förmåga både att samarbeta med andra och kunna arbeta självständigt.

- Ett starkt intresse för kommunikationsteknik.

- Ansvarskänsla - en inställning att leverera bra resultat med kvalitet.

Önskvärd kompetens

Erfarenhet inom något av följande områden är starkt meriterande:

- Erfarenhet av utveckling inom området Software Defined Networking (SDN).

- Kunskap / erfarenhet inom Information Assurance, Cyber Security och virtualisering.

- Erfarenhet av att arbeta med kommunikationsteknik som t.ex. radio, modem, satellittjänster.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Join us on our journey!
Do you want to be part of a tight-knit team facing an exciting growth phase? Then we at Envoi can proudly present your next assignment - as our new Endeavour!

About Envoi AB
We shouldn't say too much, but we probably have the world's funnest job. Envoi is a consulting company where we work with exciting assignments throughout Sweden, and since 2018 have worked with leading organizations through digital transformation.



About Job
We are currently looking for more consultants who want to join us on our journey forward! As an IT consultant with us, we help you develop in your role and find customer assignments that match your skills and interests.

You will work outside on assignment with one of our customers. The position is a full-time permanent position, where you will be employed as a consultant with us at Envoi.



Assignment Description
The team will have responsibilities related to digital maps of industrial sites and also the tools needed to create, verify, distribute and update the maps during operation.*

Requirement:



- Software development in Java/C/C++, including software modularisation and methods for creating high code quality.
- Robotics, computer science, autonomous systems or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
- 3D geometry and graphics.
- User interface and SW-tool development.
- Agile development methodologies, like CI/CD, SCRUM and other modern development methods.
- Service minded and communicative team player.



Education:

BSc/MSc or similar experience

Language:

Fluent in English

Interested?
Do you have a background that meets the requirements above? Welcome with an application! Selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis and the position may be filled before the application deadline.



What do we offer?
We take care of our employees and as an employee with us you get to be part of an exciting journey where in your role you will help organizations in their digital transformation.

With customers throughout Stockholm in system development and technology, you get the opportunity to work in a wide range of industries. If you have a drive to develop and be challenged with great flexibility, then becoming part of our Envoi team is a good start.

As a consultant with us at Envoi, your needs and your development are in focus and of course we offer all our employees decent conditions, health benefits, collective agreements and the conditions needed for you to develop - both in terms of skills and personality.

-
Attractive employment conditionsWe at Envoi AB provide excellent conditions, occupational pension, salary change and insurances. Today we have a collective agreement with Almega and Unionen.

-
Personal developmentWe at Envoi want you as an employee to develop according to your conditions in order to reach your full potential. With us, you get access to both short- and long-term skills and personal development.

-
Assignments based on your interestAs a consultant at Envoi AB, you have committed salespeople who find assignments based on your interests and skills. We have customers throughout Stockholm in system development, test and requirements management and IT project management. With us, you get the opportunity to work in a number of different industries.

-
BenefitWith us, you get generous benefits and wellness grants, you choose exactly what suits you via our portal at Benify!



Contact Information:
For more information about the position, please contact Swathi Basi, Talent Acquisition Manager, swathi.basi@envoi.se

title: Senior  Produktägare
description:
Följ med på vår resa!
Vill du bli en del av ett sammansvetsat team som står inför en spännande tillväxtfas? Då kan vi på Envoi stolt presentera ditt nästa uppdrag - som vår nya Produktägare!

Envoi är ett konsultbolag där vi arbetar med spännande uppdrag i hela Stockholm, och har sedan 2018 arbetat med att leda organisationer genom digital transformation.

Vi söker just nu fler konsulter som vill vara med på vår resa framåt! Som IT konsult hos oss hjälper vi dig att utvecklas i din roll och hittar kunduppdrag som matchar din kompetens och intresse.

Du kommer att arbeta ute på uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid, där du blir anställd som konsult hos oss på Envoi.

Som produktägare kommer du att vara en viktig länk mellan affär och IT. I rollen kommer du ansvara för beslutsstödsdata och arbeta strategiskt med uppgifter kopplade till teknikval och plattform för datafångst, datalagring och dataförsörjning. Du kommer leda ett cross-funktionellt team av bland annat utvecklare, testare och scrum master.

Genom nära samarbete med olika intressenter i verksamheten definierar ni tillsammans produktvisionen och produktstrategin samt vägen för att nå dit. Du kan lätt fånga upp de behov som finns i verksamheten och initierar utvecklingsaktiviteter. Du arbetar löpande med förankring i verksamheten för att skapa förståelse för vad som krävs för att vi ska nå uppsatta nyckeltal och mål.

Som produktägare ansvarar du för och prioriterar produktområdets backlog och utifrån användarinsikter och analyser, tekniska möjligheter och önskemål från verksamheten driver du proaktivt arbetet med att utveckla och optimera kunden's datahantering för att stötta behov inom ex. beslutsstöd, & kundkommunikation.

Vem är du?

Vi söker dig som har en relevant utbildning inom till exempel datavetenskap eller motsvarande. Du har varit produktägare för flera projekt och produkter och har god erfarenhet av att leda agila team.

Du är van att vara länken mellan flera olika intressenter, att leda arbete med produktvision, affärskrav och produktbackloggar samt att bygga broar och få alla att arbeta i samma riktning.

Har du en bakgrund som möter kraven ovan? Välkommen med en ansökan! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.

title: Senior Projektledare
description:
Följ med på vår resa!
Vill du bli en del av ett sammansvetsat team som står inför en spännande tillväxtfas? Då kan vi på Envoi stolt presentera ditt nästa uppdrag - som vår nya Senior Projektledare!



Om Envoi AB
Vi ska inte säga för mycket, men vi har nog världens roligaste jobb. Envoi är ett konsultbolag där vi arbetar med spännande uppdrag i hela Sverige, och har sedan 2018 arbetat med att leda organisationer genom digital transformation.



Om jobbet
Vi söker just nu fler konsulter som vill vara med på vår resa framåt! Som IT konsult hos oss hjälper vi dig att utvecklas i din roll och hittar kunduppdrag som matchar din kompetens och intresse.

Du kommer att arbeta ute på uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid, där du blir anställd som konsult hos oss på Envoi.



Uppdragsbeskrivning
Detta uppdrag avser IT-projektledning av ett projekt inom ett större prioriterat program hos kund. Du kommer ansvara för koordinering av flera områden inom IT, varför stor vikt läggs på erfarenhet och förmåga att leda flera team.

I arbetsuppgifterna ingår sedvanliga projektledaraktiviteter såsom att planera, leda, samordna och administrera projektet genom alla projektfaser, så att målsättning och delmål uppnås enligt tidplan och med gott resultat. I arbetsuppgifterna ingår också förankring i organisationen samt överlämning till en förvaltningsorganisation.

SKALLKRAV
 Teknisk högskole- eller universitetsexamen eller motsvarande erfarenhet förvärvad på annat sätt
 Minst 5 års erfarenhet som IT-projektledare
 Erfarenhet från tekniskt komplexa IT-projekt, med samverkan mellan verksamhet, drift, förvaltning, program/projekt, samt leverantör.

Intresserad?
Har du en bakgrund som möter kraven ovan? Välkommen med en ansökan! Urval och intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum.


Kontaktinformation

För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Menna Belacevic, Talent Acquisition Manager, menna@envoi.se

title: Business Intelligence Developer
description:
Job descriptionSobi is looking for a Business Intelligence Developer to join our ERP & BI team at Global IS/IT. The IS/IT department is managed in-house and act as a strategic enabler for the implementation and support of business systems at Sobi. Join us!As a Business Intelligence Developer, you will be developing BI tools and solutions for increased efficiency and improved strategic analysis within Sobi. Your input will make a difference, and the area is of high priority!Sobi is a dynamic and growing company with a high pace of change. This requires well functioning and up to date IT and business systems to support the high pace and Sobi’s business strategies, and to ensure that we are fulfilling regulatory requirements applicable to the pharmaceutical industry.

ResponsibilitiesPrimary areas of responsibility;Your primary areas of responsibility will be the work with our MS based BI platform and mainly Power BI. You will participate in new development projects, day-to-day maintenance, and further development of existing reports. You will play a key part in progressing Sobi´s BI function.Example of projects/areas to lead/support are;Working with front-end design; as well as with architecture and infrastructureTogether with back-end specialists define and develop new end-to-end solutions Advise on report and technical solutions to solve business requirementsClose co-operations with business stakeholders; within the financial, supply and R&D area to define and develop new report requirements
QualificationsRequirements:Minimum 3-5 years of experience within Business Intelligence, data warehouse and Data Analytics as a BI DeveloperExperience in design patterns from software development ex; GIT Experience in managing access at various levels, Row Level Security and deployment pipelinesTechnical skills in data modeling, back-end architecture, and design (MS SQL and/or Azure SQL)Experience in Microsoft BI solutions (e.g., SSIS, Azure Data Factory, Azure Analysis Services)Good knowledge of the Power BI suite and technology (DAX, Power Query/M formula, Calculation Groups and in secondary tools like Tabular Editor) University Education in Computer Science and/or Engineering or similar knowledgeFluent in English in both written and spoken and Swedish is meriting Personal attributesOur values (Partnership, Ambition, Ownership, Urgency, all sourced by Care) form the base for our daily work. Therefore, your professional style should be:Well-organized, efficient, and self-motivated. Demonstrate good interpersonal skills including the ability to interact well with a variety of personalities, organizational and educational levels. Can and will do attitude. Ability to work independently, pay attention to detail, maintain accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies. Analytical, problem solver, and solution and customer oriented. In addition, you must demonstrate behaviors in line with Sobi's core values: Care, Ambition, Urgency, Ownership and Partnership.

About the companySobi offers the opportunity to work at an international pharmaceutical company focused on specialty pharmaceuticals meeting the high medical needs of rare disease patients and providing treatment and services to them. Our employees come from a variety of backgrounds within research, healthcare, industry and the academic sphere.Sobi is a dynamic and growing company with a high pace of change. This requires well functioning and up to date IT and business systems to support the high pace and Sobi’s business strategies, and to ensure that we are fulfilling regulatory requirements applicable to the.Apply now!We will interview candidates on going so do not hesitate to submit your application down below. Deadline for application is June 15th 2023. In this recruitment process, Sobi is cooperating with Randstad Technologies. If you have any questions regarding the position, feel free to contact recruitment consultant Ann-Christine Holmer at ann-christine.holmer@randstad.se, 070 221 5970.

title: Full stack Developer
description:
Join us on our journey!
Do you want to be part of a tight-knit team facing an exciting growth phase? Then we at Envoi can proudly present your next assignment - as our new Endeavour!



About Envoi AB
We shouldn't say too much, but we probably have the world's funnest job. Envoi is a consulting company where we work with exciting assignments throughout Sweden, and since 2018 have worked with leading organizations through digital transformation.



About Job
We are currently looking for more consultants who want to join us on our journey forward! As an IT consultant with us, we help you develop in your role and find customer assignments that match your skills and interests.

You will work outside on assignment with one of our customers. The position is a full-time permanent position, where you will be employed as a consultant with us at Envoi.

Assignment description
We are looking for an experienced and skilled full-stack developer to strenghten our team in the journey of developing future Sales Tools for the company. Join us an work with the latest technologies in an cloud environment.

Requirement:

We assume that You:

- Are a driven team-player with ability to take initative

- have a good experience of requirement analysis

- are passionate about code quality

- see test automation as a natural part of the development process

- are experienced in developing modular web solutions based on microservice architecture and cloud

- have experience in and appreciate agile working methods like Scrum/Kanban

- are experienced in .NET Core, WebAPIs, Angular, React, Gitlab, CI/CD, Jira

Language

Communication skills in Swedish (good) English (must)

Meriting:

Developing in AWS with cloud native services like AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, S3

The team is combining work from home office with meeting up at Sodertalje Office up to 2 days a week.

Note: Candidate should have Sweden work permit , Permanent Residency or Citizenship.





Interested?
Do you have a background that meets the requirements above? Welcome with an application! Selection and interviews take place on an ongoing basis and the position may be filled before the application deadline.



What do we offer?
We take care of our employees and as an employee with us you get to be part of an exciting journey where in your role you will help organizations in their digital transformation.

With customers throughout Stockholm in system development and technology, you get the opportunity to work in a wide range of industries. If you have a drive to develop and be challenged with great flexibility, then becoming part of our Envoi team is a good start.

As a consultant with us at Envoi, your needs and your development are in focus and of course we offer all our employees decent conditions, health benefits, collective agreements and the conditions needed for you to develop - both in terms of skills and personality.

-
Attractive employment conditionsWe at Envoi AB provide excellent conditions, occupational pension, salary change and insurances. Today we have a collective agreement with Almega and Unionen.

- Personal development

- We at Envoi want you as an employee to develop according to your conditions in order to reach your full potential. With us, you get access to both short- and long-term skills and personal development.

-
Assignments based on your interestAs a consultant at Envoi AB, you have committed salespeople who find assignments based on your interests and skills. We have customers throughout Stockholm in system development, test and requirements management and IT project management. With us, you get the opportunity to work in a number of different industries.

-
BenefitWith us, you get generous benefits and wellness grants, you choose exactly what suits you via our portal at Benify!

Contact information
For more information about the position, please contact Swathi Basi, Talent Acquisition Manager, swathi.basi@envoi.se

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Modulai works with fish, trains, clothes, money, pets, office spaces, sound sensors and much more. If there is data, we do ML (Machine Learning) on it. Our team consists of devoted ML engineers with strong track records from some of Sweden’s most successful startups. We work on project basis and take end-to-end responsibility. We love ML and we think that the best way for us to expand our knowledge is to be exposed to a diversified set of challenging and fun projects. MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEER As a member of the ML-team you will be working with a broad range of problems with one common denominator – ML will be the key ingredient. The projects could be external as well as internal – and in all cases – delivery is central. You will have to analyze the problem at hand, come up with a solution strategy and execute on it. This typically entails gaining an in-depth understanding of the challenge, understanding the available data and then re-formulating it as a ML problem. It requires openness, creativity and an eagerness to learn new methodology and exploring new terrains. We frequently attack these problems as a team, meaning that you will have to be able to clearly explain your reasoning and code in order to engage the rest of us. Our Stack Python / R – standard open source libraries Scikit-learn and various specialized Python and R ML libraries Deep learning frameworks such as Pytorch and Tensorflow/Keras Cloud platforms such as GCP and AWS Relational database management systems Distributed processing such as Apache Spark Responsibilites Analyzing and planning problem, solution and delivery Preprocessing, feature engineering and dataset creation Validation of results Preprocessing, feature engineering and dataset creation Data pipelining and infrastructure development.Background & Skills MSc or PhD in a quantitative field Excellent understanding of a broad set of ML algorithms and frameworks A passion for lean, clean and maintainable code The desire to grow and to share insights with others.Helpful knowledge Deep learning frameworks and theory Data pipelining and infrastructure Some basic devops stuff, creating and maintaining instances. Apply here: https://modulai.teamtailor.com/

title: Product Owner to Customer Channel
description:
At Bluestep Bank, we are passionate about enabling more people to get a mortgage. Our vision is to increase financial inclusion in society in a responsible way; by embracing our customers’ differences and focusing on their future potential.

During the last few years, we have built a modern and stable platform and we are now increasing focus on our digital customer experience with the target to become more data-driven and to create a simple and fast digital mortgage process.

We are growing like never before, bringing in competencies in-house and expanding our tech capabilities. Our market is growing as well and we take steps toward creating a more customer-friendly digital experience. We are now recruiting a Product Owner to take the driver’s seat to make this happen and to be responsible for the area that we call Customer Channels. Join us on our journey to become a digital mortgage supplier for everyone on an international level. Welcome as you are.

What you will do
As a Product Owner, you will be responsible for and a part of our Customer Channels, an area that explores and defines customer channels and customer communication solutions. You will drive the transformation towards a fully digital customer interaction experience. You will lead the roadmap and together with business stakeholders and your tech team take steps towards achieving this in the best possible way.

The way of working is based on agile development through two-week sprints. You will lead and work in close collaboration with the cross-functional teams consisting of Business Analysts, Developers, and Testers that all strive to improve Bluestep’s channel experience.

Some of the areas of responsibility:

- Together with key business stakeholders drive the transition to a more user-friendly and digital customer experience

- Create a product roadmap, that you will help to break down into agile development with a design thinking approach making sure that the end result is truly customer-centric

- Focus on building a data-driven product and customer experience centered culture.

You will report to the Head of Product & Analytics, you will also work closely with the Business Transformation and Data & BI teams.

Who you are
To succeed in this role, we believe that you have a genuine interest and passion for customer solutions by being the voice of the user! You strive to find ways to make it easier for both customers and push boundaries to make this happen. As a product owner, you need to understand both the business and the tech knowledge, and how to build a user centric product and make the solutions as easy as possible.

We have a journey to make this vision a reality and we believe you are the right person to take up this challenge. We see that you have:

- Experience in digitalization by tracking and understanding customer journeys and needs

- Experienced working with agile development methodologies

- Experience working in cross-organizational contexts, from business to Digital Products and Services

- Cultural awareness and love to work in a multicultural environment

- The willingness to learn and are driven by knowledge sharing and growing together with the organization.

Does this sound interesting? 

Interviews are held continuously, please submit your application today. We look forward to reading your application!

More about Bluestep Bank
As part of our company, you will be part of an open-minded and inclusive culture, characterized by engagement and innovation where we dare to challenge and change. We believe in the values of cooperation and different perspectives. For the right person, we provide great opportunities for an exciting career. Welcome as you are.

There is no time like the present - Apply now!

title: Tech Lead - Cloud & Back-end
description:
Pushing boundaries for a sustainable future

Can clean-energy tech change the world? We say yes. Here’s why. The way we heat our homes today is responsible for 15% of all of Europe’s CO2 emissions. Switching to sustainable, clean energy solutions is the easiest and most impactful way households can play their part in net zero.

We are a next-generation home energy champion. We passionately believe that creating smart, sustainable homes is our way to make a positive impact in the world. Clean-energy tech is purposeful work. Urgent work. We’d love you to do it with us.

About the role
We are looking for a Tech Lead for our cloud and backend applications. We are looking for somebody who can coach their peers and create the structures that help our users get the most out of their home appliances and energy sources. You will be the go-to person to ask questions on how to solve problems related to our backend services and cloud applications. You will work in a Full Stack capacity with a focus on either the frontend or backend part of our product.

You will be part of the team that focuses on the customer journey which aims to help our customers gain the most benefit from our products. This entails everything from creating loyal customers over time to optimizing the way our customers interact with our products.

Engaging our customers with their energy decisions is important, and our systems will support that. 

You will actively participate in the discussions around how to improve the customer journey for different countries, demographics, and user characteristics. You will help develop the features and applications that ensure a seamless customer journey from the moment that the customer has installed our product and starts using our applications. Here you can think of solutions that inform our customers of their own impact, support user decisions, visualize data analytics, and many more ways of improving the customer journey.  



Your responsibilities include:

- Coach your peers and help them resolve their problems
- Writing clean and scalable code
- Testing, improving, and maintaining your own code
- Controlling and improving our databases and infrastructure in general


What we would like you to have
From a technical perspective we would like you to have:

- 4-5 YoE of product-driven software development
- Some experience as a Tech Lead or similar role where you coach others
- Understanding of how code structures are connected
- Agile methodologies/Scrum
- Experience with Kotlin, Spring Boot, and React


We would even appreciate it if you have some experience with/knowledge of some of the following:

- Functional programming
- Rust
- Rapid growth journeys (start-ups, scale-ups, new environments)
- Node.js & Next.js
- SQL/PostgreSQL
- MongoDB
- Kubernetes & Docker
- Terraform


As a person, we would like you to be:

- Entrepreneurial and confident
- Open-minded and initiative-taking
- A teamplayer, motivator and excellent communicator


What’s in it for you
- Competitive salary
- Rewarding secondary benefits
- The chance to build a global company and transformative products
- Fast-moving growth journey making a positive impact on the world
- Supportive and inclusive culture alive with learning opportunities


At Aira, We’re not just champions of next-generation energy, we’re champions in Diversity and Inclusion too. We believe that a diverse workforce sparks innovation and creativity and enables us to better serve our customers and communities. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. We will never accept any form of discrimination and believe that together, we can drive a new era for our people and planet.

Ready to find true purpose in your work?
Send me your application today. Any questions? I’m here to help. You’ll find my contact details below.

title: Rust Developer
description:
Pushing boundaries for a sustainable future

Can clean-energy tech change the world? We say yes. Here’s why. The way we heat our homes today is responsible for 15% of all of Europe’s CO2 emissions. Switching to sustainable, clean energy solutions is the easiest and most impactful way households can play their part in net zero.

We are a next-generation home energy champion. We passionately believe that creating smart, sustainable homes is our way to make a positive impact in the world. Clean-energy tech is purposeful work. Urgent work. We’d love you to do it with us.

About the role
We are looking for a Rust developer that will help us gap the bridge between our low-level code and cloud infrastructure. You will work in our Engagement team, the team that focusses on the entire customer journey after the purchase of our product. This team is focussed on delivering the best offering to our clients and to engage them with our products.

You will work at the intersection of embedded systems and cloud computing, playing a critical role in designing and developing software that enables seamless communication and data transfer between low-level devices and cloud-based applications. You will work closely with a team of hardware engineers, software developers, and cloud architects to define software requirements and design specifications, write and test code, troubleshoot issues, and deploy software to embedded systems and cloud platforms.

This role will take the lead in how we develop within the Rust environment. You will set the framework of our activities and lead/help other developers with guidance in their operational activities. Your other responsibilities include:

- Designing and developing embedded systems software using Rust and related tools, including pipelines, testing, and automation.
- Collaborate with other developers, including hardware engineers, software developers, and cloud engineers, to ensure seamless integration between different layers of the system.


Who are you

From a technical perspective, we would like you to have: 

- 5-8 years of commercial experience within software development
- 1-2 years of commercial experience with Rust
- Experience with Linux
- Experience in a product company and/or start-up environment
- Understanding of how IoT and wireless devices can be connected
- Agile methodologies/Scrum


We would even appreciate it if you have some experience with/knowledge of some of the following:  

- Experience working with IoT, Bluetooth and wireless devices
- Experience with Kotlin
- Knowledge of databases (SQL/PostgreSQL, MongoDB)
- DevOps understanding; maintaining own code (AWS)
- Kubernetes/Docker & Terraform experience


As a person we would like you to have/be:  

- High ambition and entrepreneurial mindset (self-starter)
- A personality who thrives in an ever-changing environment and can create structure from the ground up
- Fast-moving and solution-oriented
- Flexibility to learn new programming languages and stacks


What’s in it for you
- Competitive salary
- Rewarding secondary benefits
- The chance to build a global company and transformative products
- Fast-moving growth journey making a positive impact on the world
- Supportive and inclusive culture alive with learning opportunities.


At Aira, We’re not just champions of next-generation energy, we’re champions in Diversity and Inclusion too. We believe that a diverse workforce sparks innovation and creativity and enables us to better serve our customers and communities. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. We will never accept any form of discrimination and believe that together, we can drive a new era for our people and planet.



Ready to find true purpose in your work?
Send me your application today. Any questions? I’m here to help. You’ll find my contact details below.

title: Backend Developer
description:
Pushing boundaries for a sustainable future

Can clean-energy tech change the world? We say yes. Here’s why. The way we heat our homes today is responsible for 15% of all of Europe’s CO2 emissions. Switching to sustainable, clean energy solutions is the easiest and most impactful way households can play their part in net zero.

We are a next-generation home energy champion. We passionately believe that creating smart, sustainable homes is our way to make a positive impact in the world. Clean-energy tech is purposeful work. Urgent work. We’d love you to do it with us.



About the role

We are looking for a Backend Developer to help us create web- and digital applications that allow our customers to make informed decisions on how to improve the sustainability of their homes. You will help develop the features and applications that ensures a seamless customer journey from the moment that the customer has heard of our product to the point of installation.
Our team consist of three work streams focused on different areas:

- The website, to front what we do and why
- The sales journey, to guide the customer through the process from receiving a first solution estimate all the way to an installed product in their home
- Solution design & Installations, to build the tools needed to find an optimal energy solution and smooth installation


As our Backend Developer you will actively participate in ongoing discussions, write clean and scalable code, have a close collaboration with frontend developers and other areas, and build models, integrations, and other solutions to help our customers make sustainable choices.



What characterises us as a team:

- A senior team where everyone has a lot of experience to bring to the table
- A cross-functional team setup where developers work closely with designers and product people
- An open mindset where we trust each other to make decisions
- A will to try new ways of working. Sometimes we get it right and sometimes we agree that it might not have been our brightest idea
- Team lunch at least once a week and a daily coffee train down to the lobby to get the nicer coffee


Challenges we face together:

- A changing organisation where we need to be smart around how we organise not just as a team but also our infrastructure when it comes to both code and design. We need to be open to change things as they evolve and always have scaling in mind. We like to include the whole team in these kinds of discussions to gather input and experiences from everyone in the team
- An international market, meaning there are unique needs and regulations we need to follow for each and every country we are active in. Our team is a key player that provides the technical platforms for selling our products and we collaborate with teams across the whole company
- Finding new lunch spots that fit our growing team




What we would like you to have
From a technical perspective, we would like you to have (required skillset):

- Solid experience with product-driven software development and agile environments
- Experience with Java and Spring Boot
- Automated testing at different levels (unit tests, integration tests etc.)



We would even appreciate it if you have some experience with/knowledge of some of the following (nice-to-have skills):

- Rapid growth journeys (start-ups, scale-ups, new environments)
- Databases (DynamoDB/PostgreSQL)
- Event driven architectures (Kafka)
- Cloud DevOps (Docker, Kubernetes, continuous delivery, logging, metrics)
- gRPC and Protobuf
- Terraform
- Kanban



As a person we would like you to be:

- Entrepreneurial and confident
- Open-minded and initiative-taking
- A team player, motivator, and excellent communicator






What’s in it for you

- Competitive salary
- Rewarding secondary benefits
- The chance to build a global company and transformative products
- Fast-moving growth journey making a positive impact on the world
- Supportive and inclusive culture alive with learning opportunities


At Aira, We’re not just champions of next-generation energy, we’re champions in Diversity and Inclusion too. We believe that a diverse workforce sparks innovation and creativity and enables us to better serve our customers and communities. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. We will never accept any form of discrimination and believe that together, we can drive a new era for our people and planet.

Ready to find true purpose in your work?
Send me your application today. Any questions? I’m here to help. You’ll find my contact details below.

title: Flutter Developer
description:
Pushing boundaries for a sustainable future

Can clean-energy tech change the world? We say yes. Here’s why. The way we heat our homes today is responsible for 15% of all of Europe’s CO2 emissions. Switching to sustainable, clean energy solutions is the easiest and most impactful way households can play their part in net zero.

We are a next-generation home energy champion. We passionately believe that creating smart, sustainable homes is our way to make a positive impact in the world. Clean-energy tech is purposeful work. Urgent work. We’d love you to do it with us.

About the role
We are looking for a mobile developer that will help us create our customer-facing application. You will take the lead of the development of our mobile app that helps our customer to gain insight and control over their own energy usage.

You will be part of the team that focuses on the customer journey which aims to help our customers gain the most benefit from our products. This entails everything from creating loyal customers over time to optimizing the way our customers interact with our products.

Engaging our customers with their energy decisions is important, and our systems will support that. 

You will actively participate in the discussions around how to improve the customer journey for different countries, demographics, and user characteristics. Your responsibility is to develop a high-quality, user-friendly mobile application that meet the needs of our customers.

Your other responsibilities include:

- Actively participating in ongoing discussions around design and customer journeys
- Writing clean and scalable code
- Testing, improving, maintaining your own code and debugging our mobile application
- Optimize the app’s performance
- Stay up to date with mobile technology


What we would like you to have
From a technical perspective we would like you to have (required skillset):

- 4-5 YoE of product-driven software development
- Understanding of how code structures are connected
- Agile methodologies/Scrum
- Experience with Flutter or React Native


We would even appreciate it if you have some experience with/knowledge of some of the following (nice-to-have skillset):

- Native Android/iOS development

- Material Design and Apple Human Interface Guidelines
- Rapid growth journeys (start-ups, scale-ups, new environments)
- SQL/PostgreSQL
- Kubernetes & Docker
- Terraform
- REST, GraphQL, GPRC




As a person we would like you to be:

- Entrepreneurial and confident
- Open-minded and initiative-taking
- A teamplayer, motivator and excellent communicator


What’s in it for you
- Competitive salary
- Rewarding secondary benefits
- The chance to build a global company and transformative products
- Fast-moving growth journey making a positive impact on the world
- Supportive and inclusive culture alive with learning opportunities


At Aira, We’re not just champions of next-generation energy, we’re champions in Diversity and Inclusion too. We believe that a diverse workforce sparks innovation and creativity and enables us to better serve our customers and communities. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. We will never accept any form of discrimination and believe that together, we can drive a new era for our people and planet.

Ready to find true purpose in your work?
Send me your application today. Any questions? I’m here to help. You’ll find my contact details below.

title: Frontend Software Engineer till SJ AB
description:
Alla minns vi roliga timmen! Stunden i veckan där vi fick leka lekar och äta glass under skoltid. Nu har du chansen att återigen få uppleva denna fantastiska stund - samtidigt som du arbetar med en samhällsbärande produkt. I SJs frontend-team Customer and Loyalty tycker vi att det är viktigt att förena bra kod med glädje. Det vi bygger tillsammans blir ännu bättre om vi bjuder till och har kul längs vägen. Om du delar denna uppfattning med oss och vill utveckla en samhällsfrämjande produkt vill vi gärna att du läser vidare..

Som frontendutvecklare hos oss kommer du, tillsammans med ditt team bygga nya flöden för våra kunders login- och priofunktioner samt skapa lösningar för vår företagsportal. Vi arbetar med modern teknik och ett användarcentrerat arbetssätt för att ge en kvalitativ kundupplevelse. Du kommer arbeta i nära samarbete med sex andra utvecklare, två UX-designers, en testare, en produktägare samt en Scrum Master. Som en av teamets utvecklare ser vi gärna att du drivs av att arbeta med både nyutveckling och vidareutveckling. På lång sikt vill du kanske även utgöra en ledande funktion i något av ovannämnda fokusområden? Vi tror därför att du ser dig själv som senior i din kompetens, att du har ett gott självledarskap, är nyfiken och beskriver dig som en prestigelös lagspelare med en datadriven approach. Agilt arbete är en självklarhet för dig.

Vårt team är med och lägger grunden för “nya SJ” som kommer att möjliggöra för mer effektiv utveckling och på många sätt en bättre kundupplevelse. Vi är flexibla och dynamiska i vårt arbetssätt och det finns stora möjligheter till att påverka såväl teknikval som arbetssätt mot slutprodukten. SJ har en viktig roll nu och framöver - vi är ju framtidens sätt att resa".- Karin och Daniel, utvecklare och scrum master i teamet.

Karin och Daniel tror att du kommer leverera bra i den här rollen om du har koll på...
- React
- JavaScript och TypeScript
- Test och testautomation
- WCAG och användarvänlighet

Det är också meriterande om du har erfarenhet av...
- Azure B2C AD
- Microfrontends
- Progressive Web Apps
- DevOps
- Analytics
- Monitorering
- Datadrivet arbete

Om du inte redan känner oss
SJ är ett svenskt reseföretag som erbjuder hållbara tågresor i egen regi och i samarbete med andra. Vi är också ett av Sveriges grönaste varumärken och en del av lösningen för att klimatmålen ska nås. Just nu befinner vi oss i ett spännande skede med intern transformation, internationell expansion och stora investeringar i verksamheten.

Anställningen är på hundra procent och vårt kontor är beläget i Stockholm centrum på Vasagatan 10. Vi erbjuder en hybrid-modell där du som anställd förväntas närvara på kontoret två-tre dagar/vecka eller enligt överenskommelser utifrån dina och teamets egna preferenser. Vi har kollektivavtal, friskvårdsbidrag och som anställd blir du och din familj erbjuden rabatterade privata tågresor.

Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, men kommer boka in intervjuer först i slutet av augusti. Tills dess önskar vi dig en fantastisk sommar! 🌞

title: Teknisk Projektledare till Skandia Fastigheter
description:
Som teknisk projektledare inom fastighetsnära IT skapar du framtidens fastigheter med fokus på smarta och innovativa lösningar! 

När vi är fler händer fantastiska saker. Därför skapar vi på Skandia Fastigheter rum som är särskilt utformade för samvaro. Vare sig det handlar om kontoret där vi lyfter varandra och verksamheten, förskolan där vi växer i leken, handelsplatsen där vi både handlar och hänger, eller hemmet där alla känner sig hemma. På Skandia Fastigheter sporras vi av vår höga kundnöjdhet, våra engagerade medarbetare och ett långsiktigt perspektiv på både hus och människor, i en verksamhet där öppenhet och förtroende är självklarheter. Det betyder att du inte bara får jobba i inspirerande miljöer med några av branschens vassaste (och trevligaste om vi får säga det själva) kollegor – du får även de bästa förutsättningarna för att påverka både din egen och företagets utveckling.

Vi erbjuder dig

 • Ett kundägt bolag som arbetar för att ge långsiktigt och hållbart värde tillbaka till sina kunder, tillika ägare
 • En arbetsgivare som förenklar livspusslet och värderar balansen mellan arbete och fritid
 • Goda förmåner inom bland annat: försäkringar, bolån, friskvård etc.
 • Att bli en del av en organisation som genomsyras av värdeorden: Ansvar, Engagemang, Förnyelse och Tillsammans
 • En roll som ger stor frihet att själv kunna planera och genomföra arbetet utifrån dina och projektets önskemål och behov

Det här gör du hos oss

Som teknisk projektledare hos Skandia Fastigheter i Stockholm har du en nyckelposition med stort eget ansvar för att driva digitalisering av Skandias fastigheter. Här kommer du bland annat:

 • Planera, genomföra och underhålla teknisk implementation av fastighetsnät
 • Driva och leda flera IT-projekt för att installera och integrera ny teknik i fastigheterna
 • Felsöka och koordinera åtgärder vid tekniska problem eller avvikelser
 • Ha löpande dialog och samarbeten med leverantörer och IT-driftpartners samt fånga utvecklingsbehov i dialog med verksamheten

Hos oss kommer du ansvara för att skapa en framtidssäkrad och ansluten fastighetsmiljö. Det kan innebära allt från implementation av AI-teknik till att öka säkerhet och bekvämlighet genom smarta proptech lösningar.

Ditt team och arbetsplats

Teamet som du ingår i består av ca 11 personer i roller som förvaltningsledare, it-koordinator, projektledare och support. De ansvarar bland annat för förvaltning och utveckling av verksamhetens IT-stöd, den digitala arbetsplatsen och support.

Vi har en hybrid arbetsplats där basen är på det centralt belagda kontoret på Jakobsbergsgatan 22 i Stockholm precis intill Mood-gallerian. I din roll ingår arbetsrelaterade resor.

Mer om dig

För att lyckas i rollen tror vi du haft en liknande roll som Teknisk Projektledare där du är van och trygg att driva större och mindre projekt självständigt. Vidare tror vi att du har en teknisk bakgrund med goda kunskaper inom nätverk. Det är mycket som händer inom fastighetsbranschens digitalisering där ditt intresse och nyfikenhet kring IoT, AI och proptech är viktigt för tjänsten.

Du är van vid en kommunikativ och koordinerande roll och tycker om att samarbeta med andra för att uppnå gemensamma mål. Vidare är du lyhörd och strukturerad och kan på egna initiativ söka efter förbättringar, ta ett helhetsperspektiv och tillämpa dina tekniska kunskaper!

Så här får vi kontakt
I den här rekryteringen har vi valt att samarbeta med Ada Digital som strävar efter en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! Du söker tjänsten enkelt och behöver inte bifoga några dokument. Det räcker med en motivering till varför du söker tjänsten och om du saknar CV kan du bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Följ sedan din ansökan live via vår hemsida. Urvalet sker löpande och tjänsten kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Seniora Fullstack och Frontend utvecklare
description: Vi på OpusLink arbetar med rekrytering av seniora personer inom IT. Just nu arbetar vi med ett framgångsrikt Gasellföretag från Göteborg som växer i centrala Stockholm. Dom bygger mindre bolag med olika specialistområden för att kunna arbeta mer agilt mot sina kunder och samtidigt få en grupp som kan arbeta tillsammans för att bygga bolaget alla vill jobba på. Företagets fokus ligger på individens utveckling inom Tech och bygger på förtroende och ärlighet så att alla kan skapa sin egen framgång.KravHögskole eller Civilingenjör inom relevant område. Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom Fullstack i Java eller .NetFlytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.Förmåga att arbeta självständigt eller i team. God kommunikationsförmåga och flexibilitet för att möta snabbt föränderliga krav. Du fårEn stimulerande arbetsmiljö med utmanande projekt.En platt organisation med snabba beslut och möjlighet att påverka.Möjlighet att växa och avancera inom företaget i takt med dess tillväxt. Företaget har höga ambitioner, men det finns inga vassa armbågar utan man stöttar varandra och sina kunder vilket är en av anledningarna att man är ett av Sveriges snabbaste växande techbolagen i Sverige. Dom sitter på kontor nära Blasieholmen i centrala Stockholm.OpusLink arbetar med search och rekrytering med målet att så snabbt som möjligt slussa in rätt kandidater i våra kunders egna processer som är snabba och agila för rätt profiler. Du kommer att vara anställd av kunden i Stockholm.För att söka tjänsten skickar du in CV och personligt brev via länken. Urval sker löpande. Skicka in din ansökan redan idag.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Pushing boundaries for a sustainable future

Can clean-energy tech change the world? We say yes. Here’s why. The way we heat our homes today is responsible for 15% of all of Europe’s CO2 emissions. Switching to sustainable, clean energy solutions is the easiest and most impactful way households can play their part in net zero.

We are a next-generation home energy champion. We passionately believe that creating smart, sustainable homes is our way to make a positive impact in the world. Clean-energy tech is purposeful work. Urgent work. We’d love you to do it with us.

About the role  
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join our brand-new central data engineering and data platform team. We are looking for somebody who can build shared data infrastructure elements and data pipeline pattern modules from the ground up, wrapping them with CI/CD, IaC, and similar practices, as well as developing and incubating specific data products and pipelines.

You and your team are responsible for the capabilities and pipelines to keep our data organized, accessible, and served in an easily analysed format.

Your work will be key to optimizing the reliability and performance of our organization and the different teams. You will be a core member in building and maintaining our data mesh or lake, drive change in our development processes, engineer solutions to enhance features and be a part of our data architecture to propel solutions to further levels.

 

Your other responsibilities include:  

- Contribute to shaping our common, purpose-built data landscape, from early phases to global scale, including cloud infrastructure, data pipeline modules, schema management, data transformation, and the CI/CD, testing/deployment pipelines, and IaC necessary.
- Develop end-to-end data pipelines to ingest, transform and serve data assets
- Collaborate with software product development teams to enable their autonomy in serving and consuming data in the landscape
- Introduce practices and tools to improve data reliability and performance
- Provide crucial data to adjust future business strategies
- Provide enriched data and analytics capabilities to enable discussions and motivate decisions
- Enable data- and AI-driven software, insights, and informed decisions by serving data assets in an interoperable, agile, and modern fashion


Who are you  
From a technical perspective, we would like you to have experience with:  

- Data engineering and building pipelines from the ground up

- DevOps, CI/CD, IaC
- Deployment pipelines, branching, and versioning practices
- Understanding and analysing Big Data Architecture
- Creating ELT/ETL pipelines ingesting and transforming data
- Creating data analysis tools and validation methods
- Building, testing, and maintaining database and pipeline architectures
- Experience with Python, SQL, and Terraform (experience with Go, Spark, and streaming data is an advantage)
- Experience with CICD and deployment pipeline principles
- Experience with data/analytics/ML in any major cloud platform (AWS, GCP, Azure)


As a person, we would like you to be:   

- Adaptable and hands-on, while taking into account/having an interest in the holistic perspective 
- A quick learner with a willingness to share knowledge 
- A strong communicator and team player


What’s in it for you
- Competitive salary
- Rewarding secondary benefits
- The chance to build a global company and transformative products
- Fast-moving growth journey making a positive impact on the world
- Supportive and inclusive culture alive with learning opportunities.


At Aira, We’re not just champions of next-generation energy, we’re champions in Diversity and Inclusion too. We believe that a diverse workforce sparks innovation and creativity and enables us to better serve our customers and communities. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. We will never accept any form of discrimination and believe that together, we can drive a new era for our people and planet.

Ready to find true purpose in your work?
Send me your application today. Any questions? I’m here to help. You’ll find my contact details below.

title: Integration and Automation Developer
description:
Pushing boundaries for a sustainable future
Can clean-energy tech change the world? We say yes. Here’s why. The way we heat our homes today is responsible for 15% of all of Europe’s CO2 emissions. Switching to sustainable, clean energy solutions is the easiest and most impactful way households can play their part in net zero.

We are a next-generation home energy champion. We passionately believe that creating smart, sustainable homes is our way to make a positive impact in the world. Clean-energy tech is purposeful work. Urgent work. We’d love you to do it with us.

About the role

We are expanding our Cloud and Architecture team, which plays a pivotal role in supporting the cloud infrastructure utilized by our developers to build our product. Currently, we are establishing a new team under the leadership of our Director of Cloud and Architecture. This team will primarily focus on creating integrations and business applications that bridge the gap between the various systems employed by our business stakeholders and increases the level of automation in our processes.

As a proactive partner for our business functions, you will collaborate closely with them to facilitate the development of integrations and applications that streamline their operations. Your responsibilities will encompass the entire application lifecycle, starting from gathering information and requirements, all the way to designing, implementing, testing, and continuously enhancing applications aimed at boosting efficiency and productivity.



Key Responsibilities:

- Develop back-end integrations and applications, designed with a strong focus on maintainability and correctness.
- Develop internal administrative tools to simplify manual interaction where needed.
- Actively collaborate with different business functions to understand their requirements and identify areas for improvement regarding efficiency and productivity.
- Collaboratively devise architectural design patterns and development strategies to enhance developer efficiency, prioritizing simplicity as a key principle.
- Continuously monitor and evaluate the utilization of the integration solutions, making iterative improvements whenever necessary.



What we would like you to have

To succeed in this role, we are looking for candidates who possess the following qualifications:

- At least 5 years of experience as a Java (or similar language) developer, including several years in a Tech Lead capacity.
- Proven expertise as a backend developer, with a successful track record in designing and implementing complex and simple greenfield integration solutions.
- A Master's or Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
- Proficiency in designing and constructing highly maintainable, modern applications within an open-source tech stack, preferably Java/Kotlin.
- Familiarity with DevOps principles, including experience with CI/CD pipelines, automated deployment, containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes), and infrastructure-as-code (e.g., Terraform).
- Experience with cloud services, preferably AWS.

In addition, the following qualifications would be considered advantageous:

- Experience with or interest in functional programming and strong types.
- Familiarity with or interest in architectural solutions.

As an individual, you should possess the following characteristics:

- A driven, curious, and adventurous mindset, coupled with a recognition that it is acceptable not to have all the answers and a willingness to learn.
- Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, enabling effective collaboration with cross-functional teams and stakeholders. Ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical audiences (and the other way around!)
- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify integration opportunities and deliver solutions.

What we offer

- Competitive salary

- Rewarding secondary benefits

- The chance to build a global company and transformative products

- Fast-moving growth journey making a positive impact on the world

- Supportive and inclusive culture alive with learning opportunities.

At Aira, We’re not just champions of next-generation energy, we’re champions in Diversity and Inclusion too. We believe that a diverse workforce sparks innovation and creativity and enables us to better serve our customers and communities. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team. We will never accept any form of discrimination and believe that together, we can drive a new era for our people and planet.



Ready to find true purpose in your work?
Send me your application today. Any questions? I’m here to help. You’ll find my contact details below.

title: Android Developer
description: We are looking for an Android developer to help us in our continuing mission to deliver world-class apps together with our partners. You take a great deal of responsibility and can work individually as well as in a larger team when building new features or maintaining existing ones. For us it’s important to care a great deal about the end-user experience, realising that clever technical solutions only truly shine when packaged in a way that humans appreciate.What you’ll doWork closely with fun, passionate coworkers of different backgrounds to create mobile apps used by millions of people worldwide.Assist project managers and other team members in devising technical solutions to business requirementsDeliver high-quality, well-architected code that’s clean and easy to understand and extend.Build a great end-user experience in close collaboration with designers, coming up with solutions appropriate to the Android platform and making the product shine with delightful animations and finishing touches.Who you areYou have a BSc degree in engineering preferably computer science and 3 years of native mobile development work experience.You have participated in the development of sophisticated software solutions and have experience with complex business domains.Troubleshooting and solving problems are second nature to you, and you know that finding a good solution often involves exploring all possible pitfalls.You probably have significant experience programming for the Android platform, using Java and/or Kotlin.You are used to the challenges that modern computing platforms bring such as asynchronous programming, and are comfortable with the reactive programming paradigm.You combine creativity and forward-thinking with a structured approach and can break down large features into manageable bits and pieces.Above all you love programming, and creating wonderful user experiences makes you happy! Why we think you'll enjoy working hereYou will have the possibility of working on a variety of popular apps across different industries with a huge number of actual users.We have Friday demos, make-it-break sessions, breakfast lectures, code camp and conceptathons to learn from each other and improve our ways of working.You will be part of a group of talented developers with various backgrounds and experiences who help and support each others.You can be yourself - we encourage you to follow and share your other passions. Some of us are DJs, some love knitting, others play in a band, run marathons or go skiing together.

title: .NET Fullstack Engineer to Camanio
description:
Camanio is on a mission to solve structural and societal healthcare challenges. With a people first mindset we develop sustainable, digital solutions for an intelligent and caring healthcare system.

Join our enthusiastic Digital Solutions team to develop technology that improves the care experience for everyone. We are seeking a talented Full-Stack Developer with .NET and Angular experience to join our journey with the Camanio Care platform.

Camanio AB specializes in developing technology solutions for the healthcare and care industry. We develop and provide innovative products and services to improve the quality of life for individuals with different kinds of disabilities, elderly people who need assistance and those who care for them.

Who are you?

To be successful in this role, you are curious and have a genuine interest in software development . You are innovative and creative by nature, motivated by problem solving, have the ability to reflect on the ongoing work and have over 5 years working as either backend or fullstack developer.

You will...

- Design and develop intelligent solutions that include frontend and backend systems.

- Be a controller of the requirements that is used to define the development.

- Be part of the development team, take responsibility for the product life cycle, from implementation, deployment and support.

- As a senior fullstack developer, act accordingly, by showing by example, as well as supporting the development team with mentoring, knowledge transfer and a general transparent sharing of expertise.

Experience with…

- C#/.NET Core/ASP.NET

- Angular

- Typescript

- Git

- Entity Framework

It's a huge merit if you have experience with Akka.NET or other actor based or event sourced systems. It would also be nice if you had experience with:

- Azure Cloud

- Docker & Kubernetes

- Azure DevOps

We believe that you are a curious person who enjoys working in a team with other eager and openminded developers, who can’t wait to learn more and share their knowledge. You should live or plan to live in the greater area of Stockholm being able to work in our office a few days per week. So if your a non-EU citizen, you should have a valid working permit.

What´s in it for you?

- You work with kind and knowledgeable people who have a common drive; to develop the company.

- You can be involved and influence. We involve you in the entire work process, from idea to end product.

- We have team days where we do activities and enjoy our time together.

- A workplace were you can continue to grow and have a lot of responsibility.

- Legal support for working visas, if needed- If you are a non-EU citizen, you should have a valid working permit

This sounds amazing, I can’t wait to apply !

Are you the colleague we have been waiting for? Send us your application today! We look forward to reading it. If you have any questions, please contact Nils Johansson Torstenson at nils.johansson-torstenson@camanio.com or on +46 76 511 30 50.



Camanio was founded in 2016 in Stockholm, Sweden, with the aim to improve care through high-tech solutions. We offer innovative digital solutions that provide integrity, safety and quality of life for everyone - the person in need of care, their family, caregivers and decision makers.

Camanio is a part of the AddLife Group consisting of market-leading companies within Life Science with offerings aimed primarily at the healthcare sector.

title: Java Developer
description: We know it, you know it. Most companies ramble on about purpose and making the world a better place. And pretty often it feels a bit… well, forced. But we’d like to think that our story is special for real. Hear us out. The story of Nextory began in Syria, where our founders grew up. When they were children, they witnessed how the dictatorship limited the access to books, and saw what it did to their country. So when Shadi and Ninos came to Sweden, they made it their mission to make books available to everyone. Fast forward a few years, and Nextory was born. We offer a monthly subscription where our users can read and listen to as many books as they like. Sounds like a pretty cool product to work with, right? We think so too.We’re on the hunt for a Java Developer to join our amazing team on the quest of making the world a happier and more democratic place.OUR TECHNICAL ENVIRONMENTJava 11/17 with Spring Boot and Hexagonal architectureMysql / MongoDB / RedisKafka - Event based microservicesDataDog / Overops / GCPGitlab / Gitlab-Ci WHAT YOU WILL BE DOINGAt Nextory you will create high quality software in a continuous delivery environment. You will work together with colleagues in a cross-functional environment to design, build and launch features. Our technical environment is split between Java and Ruby on Rails and you will work with scalable architecture (including microservices).As a Java Developer at Nextory you will be an important part of our team focusing on different areas of our application all with the aim to offer the best possible reading experience. With a creative mindset, you will help to create the Nextory world that our customers are invited to, with the aim to increase reading by creating richer reading experiences. The position is based in Stockholm.We believe that you…• have a university degree in computer science, or similar engineering education• have around five years or more of experience within Java and mastering software engineering good practices• appreciate doing well-written and documented code and that you take pride in writing tests as well for edge cases of your code• are comfortable in designing REST APIs for mobile applications as well as being proficient with SQL and not afraid to do some frontend if needed• have great communication skills in English which is required in the daily work• want to be an important part of a product-oriented team and you like to share your experiences and ideas - always with the end-user in mind!We are looking forward to your application which should include a CV or LinkedIn profile and we would love a link to your portfolio (Github or other)! We believe that diversity leads to success so please come join Nextory, whoever you are!
